tribe_name: Hopland Band of Pomo Indians, California

awards.description: DESCRIPTION:THIS AGREEMENT PROVIDES ASSISTANCE TO THE HOPLAND BAND OF POMO INDIANS TO BUILD ITS CAPACITY TO ADMINISTER MULTI-MEDIA ENVIRONMENTAL PROGRAMS ON INDIAN LANDS. THIS AWARD PROVIDES FULL FEDERAL FUNDING IN THE AMOUNT OF $162,581.ACTIVITIES:SPECIFICALLY, THE RECIPIENT WILL DEVELOP THE INDOOR AIR QUALITY PROGRAM WITH A FOCUS ON OUTREACH AND EDUCATION ABOUT THE IMPACTS OF INDOOR MOLDS, UPDATE THE TRIBE'S INTEGRATED RESOURCE MANAGEMENT PLAN, AND COORDINATE AND OVERSEE QUARTERLY RECYCLE AND/OR REPAIR EVENTS FOR THE TRIBAL COMMUNITY.SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:ANTICIPATED DELIVERABLES AND OUTCOMES INCLUDE AN UPDATED INTEGRATED RESOURCE MANAGEMENT PLAN, OUTREACH MATERIALS SUCH AS A HANDBOOK ABOUT INDOOR MOLDS AND INDOOR AIR QUALITY, AND REPORTING ON MATERIALS RECYCLED, RENEWED, REUSED, OR REPAIRED. TARGET BENEFICIARIES ARE THE MEMBERS AND/OR RESIDENTS OF THE HOPLAND BAND OF POMO INDIANS.
